content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_text = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(wrapped_text) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(wrapped_text, "\n")
        end
        wrapped_text *= word * " "
    end

    return wrapped_text
end
```

Example usage:
```julia
text = "In the mystical land of Julia, a brave warrior named wrap_string emerged."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```
This will print a wrapped version of the input text, with each line not exceeding the `text_width` parameter (default is 10 characters).
